definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life

pinyin: ku1 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2
ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

sentences.english: Union with Christ means that when Christ died, I died with Him.
sentences.chinese: 與基督團結意味着當基督死去的時候，我與他同死。

sentences.english: I was pissed on by a dead pig.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我被一隻死去的豬尿溼了。

sentences.english: It made many people die and even made Nado go to hell.
sentences.chinese: 它使得很多人死去，甚至差點把那多送西天。

sentences.english: Hundreds of deceased soldiers lay in a state of disarray.
sentences.chinese: 數百名死去的士兵橫七豎八地躺在那裏。

sentences.english: Death arrived at his house on the night of his demise.
sentences.chinese: 在男人即將死去的那個夜晚，死神來到了他的屋子。

sentences.english: In the trench he will die before nightfall.
sentences.chinese: 戰壕中的他將在夜暗前死去。

sentences.english: Jarod yanked his mount aside just in time to avoid an agonizing death.
sentences.chinese: 迦洛德猛拉他坐騎跑到一邊才免於痛苦的死去。

sentences.english: Pleasure is frail like a dewdrop， while it laughs it dies.
sentences.chinese: 喜樂像露珠一樣地脆弱，它在歡笑中死去。

sentences.english: We all know full well that sometimes people die in the presence of others.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道，很多人死去時身邊有人。

sentences.english: I'm half-alive but I feel mostly dead.
sentences.chinese: 我只有一半的生氣，但感覺自己大部分已死去。

sentences.english: Chickens also died from the lack of temperature control.
sentences.chinese: 擱有，雞仔因爲溫度箱峘無法度控制嘛攏死去。

sentences.english: He was at the moment finally realized that Qian Asan did not die.
sentences.chinese: 小秋此刻也終於意識到錢阿三根本沒有死去。

sentences.english: Dead jellyfish float in the waters off the Chandeleur Islands.
sentences.chinese: 死去的水母漂浮在錢德爾勒爾羣島外海水域。

sentences.english: And there were slain four and twenty thousand men.
sentences.chinese: 在這次災禍內，死去了二萬四千人。

sentences.english: There are many people who die everyday but only a few are remembered.
sentences.chinese: 每天都有很多人死去，但能被人們想起的卻少之又少。

sentences.english: He conked out in November with pleurisy.
sentences.chinese: 他患肋膜炎於十一月份死去。

definition: to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
